intro: Cryptantha gypsites, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
